column4: does anyone know how to enable external monitors when using Ubuntu 12 (on a laptop)? Mine is not being detected even though the driver should be installed
what GPU?
nvidia?
sure, then use nvidia-settings. I assume you installed the proprietary driver
how do I check to make sure? when I did a search earlier it said that ACER monitors were supposed to have the drivers preinstalled with Ubuntu... but I'd like to verify that
lspci | grep -i vga
01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: NVIDIA Corporation GT216 [GeForce GT 230M] (rev a2)
ok, did you install the proprietary video driver?
i didn't do any additional installation of drivers
ok run:  sudo apt-get install nvidia-settings
0 upgraded, 0 installed...
so it looks like the newest driver is installed. any other suggestions?
sorry, 12.04 :P :)
so this is interesting... when I installed disper, and ran the disper -l command, my external monitor is listed
if you use nvidia-settings you can config the disaply there
yes, but how do I do that?
press ALT+F2 and run the command...
hmmm
ok. so that works... but I still can't get my laptop to stop "suspending" whenever I close the lid. Even though i've changed the settings in the "Power" management settings
i'm not great with suspend, not worth it imho
